choices.D: Cloud-based traffic flows outside of the company's network.
choices.C: Monitoring detects insecure machines on the company's network.
choices.A: Web traffic is filtered through a web filler.
choices.B: More bandwidth is required on the company's internet connection.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. Cloud-based traffic flows outside of the company's network. 

Split-tunnel VPNs provide cost savings primarily because they reduce the bandwidth load on the company's network by allowing non-essential traffic to flow directly to the internet.

Selected Answer: D
D is the only answer that has anything to do with an advantage of Split Tunnel VPN's

Selected Answer: D
I chose D because split tunnel VPNs only encrypt the critical traffic within the company's tunnel. The data that isn't encrypted is non-essential, allowing the company to save on overhead and resources by having to encrypt less data.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a cost-effective advantage of a split-tunnel VPN?

A network administrator recently updated configurations on a Layer 3 switch. Following the updates, users report being unable to reach a specific file server. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If the administrator made a mistake while updating switch's ACLs, they could have inadvertently blocked traffic to the file server. This would explain why users can't reach the server despite it being up and running.

Selected Answer: A
Syslog = Port 514
. SMTP = Port 25
DNS = Port 53
 DHCP = Port 67 for Server -- Port 68 for Client - on UDP

comments.content:
You have the right answer, just small correction as this has direct connection to another question in the list. 
25: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) - Used for sending email and depreciated.
587: SMTP (Message Submission Agent) - The standard port for submitting email for transmission is what most of the current mail client use.

questions.question_text: A network engineer wants to implement a solution where all web servers will send event data over port 514. Which of the following services will accomplish this task?
A security administrator wants to discover zero-day attacks before they can be used on the companyâ€™s network. Which of the following can the administrator use to accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A honeypot is a deliberately vulnerable system set up to attract attackers. By monitoring the interactions with the honeypot, the administrator can learn about new attack techniques and exploit vulnerabilities before they are used against the actual production systems

Selected Answer: B
A honeypot is a decoy system designed to attract attackers and analyze their behavior. Since it mimics a legitimate network environment, attackers might unknowingly exploit unknown (zero-day) vulnerabilities in the honeypot before targeting real systems. Security administrators can then study these attacks, identify new threats, and develop countermeasures before they impact the actual network.

questions.question_text: Users at a satellite office are experiencing issues when using videoconferencing. Which of the following should a technician focus on first to rectify these issues?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Network should be looked at first

Selected Answer: B
QoS is important for prioritizing videoconferencing traffic, but it won't matter if the underlying network signal is weak or unstable. QoS helps manage traffic when there's congestion, but it can't create bandwidth that doesn't exist.

Selected Answer: B
Network signal will always come first.

Selected Answer: A
Videoconferencing requires low latency, minimal packet loss, and consistent bandwidth. If users at a satellite office are experiencing issues (such as lag, jitter, or dropped calls), the first thing to check is Quality of Service (QoS) settings.
